96/ I'm ending this tweetstorm here, at section "Mining software" in the transcript: http://diyhpl.us/wiki/transcripts/2016-july-bitcoin-developers-miners-meeting/cali2016/ … May continue on other platform.
91/ "If Bitcoin's fungibility breaks, people would ... move on. Block size can break fungibility, and that's why it's controversial."
90/ "If Bitcoin HF'd to unlimited size, I'd quit — Block size determines decentralization & if people can participate running the nodes."
88/ For Bitcoin, we need balance between frank technical talk and positivity, fex companies creating joint positive marketing.
84/ Ethereum devs are all getting paid in Bitcoin. (USD denominated salaries)
83/ The fact that nobody would run testnet with lots of 8 MB blocks, doesn't mean that nobody would run Bitcoin with 8 MB blocks.
80/ "a lot of miners had no opinion either way, mined [ETC] because they could make profit. Something to consider for Bitcoin's future"
I don't know! (not so far) Perhaps do a "ctrl-f" for 'block size' on the transcript: http://diyhpl.us/wiki/transcripts/2016-july-bitcoin-developers-miners-meeting/cali2016/ …
77/ Inadvertent burn: "The outcome for Ethereum is no where near as bad as it would be for Bitcoin, which is actually used by people."
72/ We're taking the human element out of Bitcoin: script validation is law. Lesson from ETH: saying "code is law" doesn't make it true".
71/ "Once we we take out the human element, then bitcoin is really immutable." - AI's writing code - Automated mining facilities
70/ Bitcoin product differentiation vs. Ethereum: Not "we don't hard fork ever", but rather "Bitcoin has vigorous duty of care".
69/ Tuur: I'm calling it a night. Plan to continue tomorrow! (Full transcript this storm is based on: http://diyhpl.us/wiki/transcripts/2016-july-bitcoin-developers-miners-meeting/cali2016/ … )
68/ "Ethereum debacle is bad for Bitcoin bc it shows that some cryptocurrencies are not trustable. Public doesn't know the difference."
67/ "Notice how outside the room it does not say 'bitcoin meeting'. FBI knows. I bet your plane ticket says."
60/ Soft forks "impose cost on all the users of bitcoin" Imposing too much too quickly => users'll ignore core, adopt strange altcoins, etc.
58/ Minority fork prevention in Bitcoin: "Even if we could make it impossible, we would lose an argument for Bitcoin's long-term safety."
55/ Bitcoin HF: unsatisfied chain "might start taking legal action" ... "[Bitcoin core devs & miners] would all be liable to some extent."
51/ Ethereum's failure mode: overconfidence. Vs Bitcoin: bit of over-engineering, good because one can't predict each failure mode.
49/ Bitcoin's UTXO model (as opposed to ETH's account model) can more easily be protected against post HF replay attacks.
48/ 1.5 yrs ago, replay attack mitigation was discussed in Bitcoin-dev chat channel w/regards to bitcoin, bc of Mike & Gavin's HF proposals.
47/ # TheDAO: "response time seemed slow to me. ... Past Bitcoin network incidents, response time was much faster I think."
35/ Maintaining Bitcoin's unique value propositionpic.twitter.com/FQ5bSqQ2ga
34/ Positive outcome for Bitcoin in 5-10 years: "the same amount of distribution and value as gold."
33/ Paypalisation risk: "One potential outcome for bitcoin is for exchanges to become banks or bought by banks or incorporated into banks."
32/ This next part is a new session, titled "Future outlook of Bitcoin".
/28 "In Ukraine, our partners have already designed a Bitcoin miner that works like a heater for a house. It creates warm water."
22/ "potential that Bitcoin mining will shift [from China] to the West because regulation, the legal system and the power cost"
21/ Commoditization of Bitcoin mining: "Yes we're hitting a wall" "improvement of mining tech will have to wait on improvement of chip tech"
20/ Bitcoin mining: 20x technology improvement in 3 years timepic.twitter.com/jpkk3YU6Gz
19/ ASIC development for mining: "Bitcoin experienced technology improvement journey of 13 year semiconductor technology in about 3 years."
13/ "I do work on lightning network. My intent is to help make bitcoin great again."
10/ Forking: unlike Linux, "bitcoin consensus protocol needs only 1 chain otherwise we have problems like ETH is presently experiencing"
9/ Lightning: "not just for bitcoin, .... any coins that exist can be connected together into lightning network ... might help fungibility"
8/ Bitcoin scaling helps with fungibility: "if we don't broadcast as much information ... you broadcast less data"
7/ "fungibility is a big problem for Bitcoin"... "if we had a space-efficient secure protocol to do fungibility, we would do that right now"
6/ Lightning network as decentralized exchange: "I could send a lightning payment on bitcoin that releases a lightning payment on litecoin"
4/ We're building "marine shipping containers for bitcoin mining", "You just need the power at your location" ... "immersion cooling"
3/ Cost of spinning a Bitcoin node more than blockchain download time. "Maybe in 5 yrs, nobody would be able to download the blockchain."
